snippet: Regulators took the unusual step of closing the entire Maine shrimping season to give a historically low supply time to recover, worrying those whose livelihoods depend on it.
abstract: Regulators take unusual step of closing the entire 2014 Maine shrimping season to give a historically low supply time to recover; decision brings some hope to fishermen and processors whose livelihoods depend in part on the shrimp’s making a comeback, even as they wonder how to weather this season, and perhaps longer, without it.
lead_paragraph: Regulators took the unusual step of closing the entire Maine shrimping season to give a historically low supply time to recover, worrying those whose livelihoods depend on it.

headline.main: Daunting Calculus for Maine Shrimpers as Entire Season Is Lost
headline.print_headline: Daunting Calculus for Maine Shrimpers as Entire Season Is Lost
